Researchers are anxious now to hear decisions on existing funding calls, see parity of esteem for the humanities, fresh investment in research equipment and support for fundamental research. When I was in primary school, admittedly a long time ago, I remember getting lots of half-days when Cork were winning things! Wishing the Cork Senior Hurling Team the very best today in the All Ireland Final! Up the Rebels! #UpCork GAA #Cork

Starting off the week with the story of Trinity microbiology student Melanie Griffith whose resilience after a life-changing accident is just so inspiring.üí™ Read all about it in Trinity Today, the fantastic publication of Trinity Development & Alumni. üëâ https://lnkd.in/eXSvPR-P Trinity College Dublin Sport TCD Alumni Trinity College Dublin Global Trinity College Dublin

Our amazing Formula Trinity students revealed their new car in Front Square this evening. Off to Silverstone next week for the student competition - wishing them the very best of luck üèÅüèÅüèÅüèéÔ∏è Trinity College Dublin Trinity College Dublin Global Trinity College Dublin Alumni

We are hiring a Chief Operating Officer who will be responsible for the overall daily operations of Trinity College Dublin across multiple locations, providing strategic leadership to ensure the delivering of high-quality services for students and staff. Full details here: üëâ https://lnkd.in/gnmMykXG

When he visited Trinity in 2022, Keir Starmer spoke encouragingly about cooperation between Irish and UK universities. Looking forward to progress in this space in the years ahead. Irish Universities Association Trinity College Dublin Trinity College Dublin Global Dr. Emma Stokes

At our monthly all-staff update, Prof. Jane Stout, our VP for Biodiversity & Climate Action, shared this striking visual (UN IPCC) showing how generations are being born into a hotter world. For someone born in 2020, the extent of warming highly depends on our response to climate change today. Trinity College Dublin Trinity College Dublin Global Trinity College Dublin Alumni

Congratulations to Martin Worthington on being awarded an ERC Advanced Grant. It‚Äôs fantastic to see a prestigious body like the ERC appreciate the research value of the Arts and Humanities.
